column1: back of a length, holding its line outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, taps to backward point to get off the mark
yorker, angled into middle, dug out to the on side
full, angled into the pads, clipped uppishly over midwicket
short of good length, punches off the backfoot and finds an inside edge that goes behind square
back of a length on off, defended from the crease
fuller of a length outside off, driven to cover
angled into the left-hander, pushed out to mid-on
shortish, seams away and squares him up as it beats the outside edge
flicks this past the right of midwicket
flicks this away off the pads through midwicket. Imam gives it a good chase but the ball just beats him, rolls into the boundary as he gets a finger to it
angles in a length ball that's tickled fine
defends a length ball down the pitch
short of a length on off, punched to point
blocks a length ball to cover
short ball over off, gets under it easily
short of a length around off, shuffles across and blocks
back of a length, tries to tuck and grazes the pad. Sarfraz gets down to his right but not enough to get the ball
defends this length ball back
good length outside off, blocked to point
short of a length, angled into middle, moves across and tries to flick and wears it on the pad
chops a short ball into the surface as he cuts

edged and gone. Nicely fired in the channel outside off, getting him to reach out. Worker falls for it and sticks the bat out and gets done in by extra bounce as the ball goes off the edge to the keeper
shot. Full, a bit of width on offer outside off and he creams a drive through extra cover
short of a length, tucks in front of mid-on for a quick one
length on middle and off, defended back
back of a length outside off, opens the face to backward point for one
short outside off, pulled to deep midwicket
back of a length on middle, defended

dropped. Babar Azam puts down a sitter at slip. Beautifully bowled by Shaheen, in the corridor and full enough to make him jab at it. Does so away from the body without getting the body behind the shot and gets a thick outside edge that Babar spills at shin height
well, doesn't matter is he's been dropped the previous ball. Stands and swings at this and gets beaten big time
just offers up a little bit of extra room and that's much better from Munro, throws his weight behind a drive through the covers
tucked through midwicket
taps it to the left of mid-off for one
full, pushed across, driven to mid-off
length on middle, defended
length, tight lines on off, inside edges the defence to the back thigh
short of length on off, defended
good length on off, defended
short ball, a nice swivel pull from around off through square leg
short of length on off, kept out
short of length, cuts in sharply from outside off and beats the inside edge of his flashing bat
takes a step down the ground and flays this length ball, off the toe end but good enough to clear mid-off
good length on off, punched back

Munro has reviewed an lbw call.  Beautiful delivery from Afridi. A slower one that completely cut him in half. Beats the inside edge on his half-forward push and pings him in front of leg. The angle's sharp but straight enough to crash into leg. Wickets hitting. Review lost
short of length, tucked through square leg
length, angling in, taps it through square leg
tucks a length ball through midwicket
short of a length, slapped to point
short of length outside off, blocked to point
full outside off, driven to the left of mid-off
good length outside off, taps it past a diving point
short of a length, tucked off the pads behind square
tucked from outside off through midwicket
full on middle and leg, blocked to the leg side from the crease
opens up for a backfoot punch and inside-edges to the pad
full, pushed across, driven to mid-off
short of length on off, blocked towards mid-on
short of good length, cuts into off, punched towards point
short of length on off, defended
blocks in front of middle
length on off, blocked to mid-off
full outside off, driven to sweeper cover
advances down the ground and blocks
sliding into leg, swept to short fine
pitched up outside off, defended
comes down the track and clips to wide long-on
looped up on middle, turned away to midwicket
swept to deep backward square leg
blocks a length ball to mid-off
full, crunched to the right of the bowler
short of a length outside off, pulled through deep midwicket
fuller of a length outside off, drilled off the inside of the bat to the bowler
length, angled into off, flicked to square leg
back of a length outside off, inside-edges to the pad as he opens up
looped up on off, eased wide of long-off
length outside off, punched off the backfoot to long-off
fuller on off, driven to mid-off
full, slid into middle, pushes to point and yells out a no as Taylor comes looking for a run
advances and clips to midwicket who misfields slightly
drifts one into middle, driven down the ground
short and wide, chops a cut to point
short and wide, slapped through backward point
short ball, pulled to deep midwicket
length on off, just dabs it with a straight bat towards mid-off who dives to his right but lets the ball go through
tucks a short of a length ball to deep fine leg
back of a length, chops a cut to cover
inducker on the pads, Williamson knocks it away around the corner for one
darted short and wide outside off, Taylor sits back, latches onto it and thumps a square cut. No stopping that
just short and outside off, holds its line, punched through the covers
short and slides in at off stump, cracked to sweeper cover off the back foot
forced down to long-off for a single
tossed up slower and higher on middle stump, patted down to long-on with the incoming angle
lobbed up outside off, non-turner, Williamson stretches out and drives back
shorter and spins away outside off, Williamson moves back and chops to backward point
very full and outside off, Williamson props forward and eases it to the covers
another velvet-smooth drive from Williamson but he can't beat cover

What have you done, Kane? Rank half-tracker, 90ks, breaks away outside off, that deserved to be tonked out of the ground. Instead, Williamson pulls it straight into the lap of short midwicket. Lucky break for Shadab in his first over
pretty full and turns back into Latham, he carelessly flicks and inadvertently sends an inside edge to the fine leg boundary
Taylor goes low and sweeps with the break to deep square leg
tossed on middle, spins away, tipped to the covers
poked to mid-off
full on middle and leg, tapped with the break to mid-on
pushed through faster, beats the sweep, and hits the front pad outside the line
non-turner, on a length and outside off, stabbed back to the bowler
turn and bounce, darts back in, Latham sits back and flaps it wide enough of short midwicket
speared into middle, tickles a sweep to short fine leg
full and rolls on off, defended back
Taylor goes back and jabs a legbreak from outside off to the covers
full on middle and leg, clipped past the left of short midwicket
punched up to short cover with the turn
goes for a sweep and inside-edges it to short fine leg. Okay, no bat involved, leg bye
Taylor now sweeps and secures a single to fine leg

Latham plays around a straight ball and is pinged on the pad. Umpire Raza shoots down Hafeez's lbw appeal. He and Sarfraz want a review. Struck on the front pad well below the knee-roll. No bat involved at all. This looks pretty close. Ball-tracking returns umpire's call on leg stump. Just clipping the outside of the leg stump. Pakistan retain the review in the end
on a length on off, tapped back to the bowler
down the track and hit to long-on
paddled from the stumps to fine leg
pushed through outside off, defended
drilled to sweeper cover
full on the stumps, driven down to long-on
full on off, defended
flat and attacking the stumps, defended
googly, spins back in, defensively dropped to the covers
full on middle, driven back down the pitch

back of a length and cramps Latham for room, he plays early and chips it back to Hafeez. It drops just short of the bowler. In the process, Hafeez has hurt his finger on his bowling hand. Hafeez gets some attention from the physio... and he's good to resume bowling
short and spins away outside off, Latham jumps back and flays it to sweeper cover
back of a length and skidding in to ping the thigh pad
short and outside off, sits back and slaps it down to long-on
uses his feet and stabs a short ball to cover
length ball, defended back
Taylor shimmies out, meets a short one on off, and hits it back to the bowler
tossed outside off, driven through the line to cover
shortish and spins away outside off, Taylor leans back and chops to backward point
good length and targetting the stumps, Taylor's tight defence intervenes
driven down to long-off to close out the over
dragged down on off, rocks back and forces a pull between deep square and deep midwicket
Taylor closes the face early and pokes a leading edge to mid-off
punched with the break to short midwicket off the back foot
full and turning into a back-foot defence to short midwicket
wafted to midwidwicket
picked off the pads into the vacant spaces square on the leg side
short and outside off, punched back
drilled through the line to sweeper cover
shortish and spins back in, Latham sits back and punches to deep midwicket
full and outside off, cracked to the covers off the front foot
length ball on off, does not spin either way, jabbed to the covers
whipped from outside off to long-on
short and outside off, forced down the ground to long-on
short and outside off, keeps back and punches up to the covers
steps out, adjusts to a slower ball and pats it down to long-on
short offbreak, spins back in, punched down to long-on
Latham skips down the track and chips a single to the left of Hafeez
Taylor keeps back and punches a short offbreak to long-on
leans back and punches to sweeper cover
swept from the stumps to fine leg. Neatly paddled away - it worked for Latham in India last year
wrong'un, fizzes back in, Taylor chops an inside edge behind to Sarfraz
rank full-toss outside off, Taylor clubs it across the line to the midwicket boundary. Taylor loosens the shackles with a mighty blow
slider, full, tapped down to long-on
lobs a low full-toss on off, which is deftly paddled down to long leg by Latham
Taylor presses forward and plays back to Hafeez
full on middle, knocked down to long-on
steps out and drives to long-off does Latham
flaps a short one to long-on
tossed on off, Latham ventures down the track, meets the pitch and beautifully chips it over midwicket
flatter and faster, turns away outside off, inside-edged behind square
short outside off, squeezed to the midwicket region
clipped off the hips to long leg
short and darts back in, stabbed back
Taylor swings and inside-edges this nip-backer back to Hasan
tip and run to the covers. Taylor keeps NZ ticking
Latham hangs back to meet this short ball outside off. Punched through the line to mid-off
leg-side wide
back of a length and swerves in, punched to mid-on
on a length and outside off, driven to long-off
punched to sweeper cover
full and spins away outside off, stretches out and drives a single to long-off
pushed through outside off, driven down to long-on off the front foot
slides in on middle, jabbed back
back of a length and slanting away outside off with the angle, Latham moves forward and finds a single to the right of mid-off
short on off, dropped to the covers for one. Excellent calling and running from these two
just short of a good length and outside off, Latham stands tall and punches the ball away to the right of mid-off for another single
worked to short midwicket
short and on off, fended back
Taylor skips down the track, dragged shorter and outside off, Taylor heaves an inside edge to long leg. He gets to his 42nd ODI fifty
full on middle, paddled to fine leg
back of a length and slides back in, punched down to long-on
tucked to square leg
chopped to backward point
short and outside off, slapped to point again, half-save from Azam
short and outside off, Latham skips back and cuts firmly to deep backward point and hares back for two
Taylor swivels and pulls a short ball from outside off to deep midwicket
short and outside off, laced away to deep point
on a length and angling away outside off, sweetly punched on the up to sweeper cover. Latham is looking like a million dollars in Abu Dhabi
short and angling in at off, defended back to the bowler
picked away to short midwicket
worked off the pads to deep square leg running in
taps a length ball into the covers for one
short of a length, angled across, opens the face past a diving point
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
short of a length on off, jumps and tucks to midwicket
ah, too short, feeding Taylor's compulsive tendency to pull, dispatched behind square
back of a length, pitching outside leg and slanted across off, blocked down the pitch
short outside off, pulled to the right of deep midwicket
full on off, driven to mid-off
clipped off the pads between midwicket and mid-on
punches a full toss towards mid-on
short ball, bounces a little extra and he hooks it along the ground to deep backward square
defends a fuller of a length ball back down the pitch
defends a length ball from outside off to midwicket
short and wide, laces to third man
full outside off, driven past the right of point
length outside off, punched through the covers
full outside off, flicked to the left of mid-on
short of a length, angling into off, punched to mid-off
fuller of a length outside off, driven to cover
flicked off the pads to the right of deep midwicket
blocks a length ball to mid-on
short of a length, pushes away from the body and gets an outside edge to third man
flicks a fuller one to deep midwicket, brings up Latham's fifty
floats up a full toss, whipped to deep midwicket
floats it up, clipped onto the pad and to the left of short fine leg
shifts back and flicks uppishly to mdiwicket
full on leg stump, clipped behind square
pulls a short one to deep midwicket
punches to mid-off for a quick one
misunderstanding on the run. Clips it to mid-on who runs to his right and dives and throws at the keeper's end but a slight fumble allows them to make it back
short of length, angled in, pulled behind square
short ball, deemed too high
short of length, opens the face and taps to point
gets forward to block to extra cover
driven through cover
shifts back and blocks it back
full, spins away, gets forward and pushes to cover
gets down for a reverse sweep and makes no contact
clipped off the pads to deep midwicket
full outside off, leans into a drive behind point
good length outside off, punched square of third man
back of a length on off, blocked to point
punched to mid-off for a quick one
tails in late and he inside-edges the flat-batted whip towards short leg
angles a fuller one in, driven to long-on
swept to backward square

huge appeal for lbw, and given. Seemed like there might've been an inside edge but Latham walks off. Flighted on middle, latham tries to flick and plays all over it as the ball beats the inside edge and pins him in front

this one looks close as well, and given. Back-to-back strikes from Shadab. Drawing Henry forward with a fuller length, flatter than the last one. Dips and curves into him to hit him in front of middle and leg. Caught in the crease

inside-edge saves de Grandhomme and denies Shadab the hat-trick. Wrong'un from Shadab, de Grandhomme has not a clue, is nowhere near it and is rooted to the crease as he whips at it and knocks it into the pad off the edge

gone next ball. Shadab on a roll, three wickets in four balls. This is a traditional loopy legbreak, floated up outside off, and getting de Grandhomme to push at it away from the body, gets an outside edge that settles low into first slip's hands
comes forward to keep out a fuller ball
length on off, tucked against the turn to midwicket
clips a fuller one to short fine

gone.. this rush of wickets could just be the turning point of the game. And this is the set Taylor. An inside edge again. Imad nicely floats it up outside off, Taylor comes forward and drills at it but the ball dips prodigiously and takes an under edge before clattering into the stumps
extremely full on off, a yorker, jammed out to cover
flicks a fuller one to midwicket
full on off, pushed to cover
defended back
defends with a slightly open face past the diving slip fielder
forward to block to cover
short, spins away, cut to point
short, cut to point who dives to his left and lets it go through
gets forward to push back
carves a drive to point
sliding into leg, pushed back
gets down to paddle to deep fine leg
jams a fuller one back to the bowler
gets forward and blocks and gets a bit of an edge towards Sarfraz
clips a fuller one to long-on
short of length, jumps and drops to point
shortish, bit of shape outside off, pushes away from the body and gets beaten
short of length, defended back
short outside off, gets hold of a pull over square leg. Great timing
whips against the line and cops it on the pad as it gets past the diving keeper
shovels a fuller one to long-on
pulled from outside off to midwicket
sprayed short outside off, cut to point
slides it in full, clipped to deep fine leg
advances and clips to long-on
flicks a fuller one to wide of long-on
shovelled over long-on. Just a tad short and a bit of room outside off, and Sodhi capitalises
worked to third man
stays leg side of it and mows this length ball to extra cover
picks up a length ball from outside off and mows it over deep backward square with the angle. That's a stunning shot. NZ will take every run they can from here
full toss, loses shape as he slaps it down to mid-off
another full toss, laced through the covers
poor from Shaheen, feeds the batsman with the inward angle and a back of a length, whipped away fine
backs away and mows it with the angle over mid-off. The fielder in the deep moves to his right and gets down in front but the ball drops short
taken at mid-off. But Sodhi has added some useful late runs here. Slower ball, the off-cutter, chipped into the air off the toe-end as Sodhi backs away to heave it over
short of a length outside off, whipped to deep backward square leg, good effort by the fielder there
picks out Junaid in the deep. A pick-up shot off the pads, length ball, whips it behind square and Junaid holds on to his left in front of the backward square leg boundary
slides into the leg side and clips the pad on its way to fine leg
low full toss, driven to extra cover
extremely full, angled into off, drilled wide of long-off
length on off, flicked to square leg
yorker, angled into off, dug out to long-off
short, pulled with the angle to deep backward square
full toss, angled into him, shovelled straight over, and goes all the way in fact, for six
inswing for Boult right away. Jags back in, but the length is short, allowing Imam to block it back off the back foot
back of a length and swings away now, punched firmly to the covers
shorter and outside off, Imam punchily drives the ball away, placed straight of mid-off, and he holds his pose like a boss
full on the stumps, forward and stroked back to the bowler
back of a length and slanted down leg for a wide
140ks short ball outside off, not much swing either way, forced off the back foot but only as far as point
in-between length, angling in, the swinging away against the angle, Imam is lavishly beaten on the outside edge
he finds inswing, too, with his first ball and has Zaman falling over the flick, but this is doing too much to threaten the stumps
full and angling away outside off, driven against the angle to mid-on. Not middled
short and running away outside off, guided off the face to point
pitched further up and angling away outside off, Zaman drives loosely and watches a thick outside edge streak down to third man
Southee finds inswing again, Imam falls over and manages to jab it to the covers
whipped away to short midwicket, where the fielder fumbles, allowing a single
back of a length and zips back in at 141ks to catch the thigh pad and roll away to the leg side

Boult angles a back-of-a-length ball into the pads of Zaman. He loses his shape, swings to the leg side, does not make contact with the bat. The ball homes in, grazes the pad, and disturbs the stumps. The plan to Fakhar was clear: cramp him for room. Boult has executed it to perfection

Boult and the wicketkeeper think they have their man! Umpires Raza and Wilson converge and refer it to the TV umpire. Boult nails a wide yorker, Azam hangs back, jabs his bat down. Did the ball bounce before carrying it to Taylor at first slip? Replays suggest that it did not bounce and flew to first slip. Outstanding chest-high grab from Taylor to go with his half-century. He ultimately hangs onto the ball on the rebound. Ahoy, two in two for Boult

Boult, you beauty! In his first match of the tour, new-dad Boult bags a hat-trick. Good length, swings back in just enough at 141ks, catches Hafeez in the crease, hits the front pad on the knee-roll. Pitching in line, impact in line, and hitting leg stump. Hafeez reviews in vain. Boult becomes the third New Zealander after Morrison and Bond to claim a hat-trick in ODIs. After Taylor seemed to publicly question the legality of his bowling action, Hafeez gets trapped for a first-ball duck. Rather subdued celebrations from Boult. He looks skywards and is embraced by his new-ball partner and friend Tim Southee
Slip and leg slip in place. He welcomes Malik with a chest-high short ball. Fended off. No four in four for Boult
short and skidding away outside off, nearly 140ks, Malik jumps back and punches feebly to cover
full on off and middle, defended to the covers
wide yorker, Imam jams his bat down... and misses
pitched up and outside off, pushed through the line to mid-off
fuller and outside off, pushed to the covers off the front foot
good length and just a shade outside off, blocked
overpitched and outside off, drilled through the line, superb stop from Worker at cover
back of a length and outside off, blocked to cover off the front foot
full inswinger, picked off to square leg
Boult has Malik hopping and fending off his chest to the leg side
Malik gets on top of this short ball outside off and unfurls a delightful back-foot punch through extra cover
short and angled down leg for a wide
short and nipping away with the angle, worked to the leg side
inswinger, the inside edge saves Malik
full on middle and leg, driven to mid-on off the front foot
full and angling into a solid push to mid-on
pretty full and drifting into the pads, all it needed was a little tickle, and Malik obliges. Glanced to the fine leg boundary
pitched further up and outside off, driven to mid-on off the front foot
full and holds its line outside off, no shot
full and on the pads, worked away through midwicket
Malik clips this full inswinger through midwicket
another inswinger, Boult keeps posing questions, glanced off the inside half to fine leg
short and banged down leg, wide
short and veering down leg again for back-to-back wides
dragged short and outside off, Imam gets on top of it and flays to deep third man
Imam hops, skips, and fends this short ball away past midwicket
back of a length and outside off, punched on the up to cover
short on middle, defended
back of a length and holds its line outside off, tapped to mid-off
full on off, driven to mid-off
good length and holds its line outside off, left alone
fuller than a good length and angling in on off, played back to the bowler
shuffles across and tucks it to deep square leg
short and homing in on the pads, Imam hops and flicks through square leg
full on middle and leg, presses forward and taps it to midwicket
short and on off, defended off the back foot
short and rushes onto Imam. He still controls a pull to deep midwicket after swivelling on the back foot
short and running away outside off, gets up on his toes and punches up to cover
back of a length and slanted down leg, wide
short and outside off, punched away but can't pierce the off-side infield
short and attacking the body, fended off
back of a length and outside off, swishes and misses
similar line and length, Imam puts bat on ball and punches with an open face towards deep third man
full and outside off, driven through the line to mid-off
short and ducks back in, poked to the leg side off an inside edge
pitched up and outside off, Malik drives aerially - he's early into it or it's the slower cutter from Southee - Taylor dives forward and drops a catch at short cover
short and angling into a solid defence on off
Imam rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and guides it off the face to backward point
short and zipping in at the top of off, Malik blocks off the back foot
short and outside off, hops and clips to short midwicket
short, wide, lashed away to backward point. Lockie Ferguson hits 145ks
shuffles across and glances off the pads to fine leg
banged in short and outside off, 139ks, tapped to point
back of a length and outside off, Imam allows the ball to come onto him, then dabs it to third man
short and outside off, swings away, punched to backward point
short on the hips, glanced to long leg
on a length and outside off, helped to third man
full on off, blocked
full and outside off, Malik plays it to point
short on off, cramps the batsman for room, defended to the leg side
short on middle, hops and fends it to midwicket
run down to deep third man
short of a length, angling in, straightens away, squares up the batsman and gobbles him up for dinner
full and speared into the pads, flicked to deep midwicket with the angle
short and flies through to the keeper, Malik looks away, flaps at it... and is beaten neck and crop by pace and bounce
short and wide outside off, Imam surges down the track and flat-bats the ball to sweeper cover
full on the stumps, tip and run to mid-on
full and sliding into the pads, picked off to the fine leg boundary with soft hands
short and outside off, glided behind square on the off side
full on the stumps, pushed to mid-on. Top running from Malik
back of a length and outside off, helped down to third man
short and keeps rising outside off, diffused to the midwicket region
pitched up and outside off, nice flowing drive from Malik but straight to short cover
short attacking the body, Malik shuffles inside the line, holds his shape, rides the bounce and tickles it away fine for four
whisked to point with an open face
short at the body, glanced past leg slip to fine leg
full on the stumps, picked off square on the leg side
flicks a length ball off the pads through square leg
full, clipped off the pads to deep midwicket
back of a length, tapped to point
advances down the ground, gets to the pitch and shovels this over mid-on. Aware of the fielder in the circle and takes a chance
goes past the outside edge as he sticks the bat out
bangs it in from around the wicket, tucked through square leg
short of a length on off, jumps back and blocks down the pitch
gone! Caught at midwicket. Short ball pays off. Fetches a pull from too far across and chips it in the air, dragged off the toe end to de Grandhomme. Loose shot outside off
shortish, angled across off, opens the face to third man
jumps back to a short ball and keeps it down firmly
short on middle and off, jumps back and blocks down the pitch
turns a fuller one away through backward square leg
gets forward to a length ball and pushes to mid-off

this is awful, awful batting. And it's Shoaib Malik, with all his experience. He has bailed Pakistan out on many an occasion, but not today. Advances down the ground and backs himself to go over mid-off. Nowhere close to doing so. Chips a face-high catch to Williamson at mid-off who grabs it reverse-cupped. Just not the kind of batting Pakistan need at the moment
good length on middle and leg, blocked
fullish, tails away, comes forward and pushes to mid-off
full around off, drilled down the ground
banged in short on middle, 138ks, Sarfraz jumps off the ground and diffuses this rapid ball to the leg side
short and angling away outside off, Sarfraz nicely rides the bounce and glides the ball to deep third man
short and zipping away outside off, rushes the batsman for pace and bounce, from around the wicket, Shadab hops and fends over Southee at wide slip
Ferguson socks Sarfraz on the glove. Dug in short, skids off the pitch, Sarfraz looks away and cops a blow
shorter and outside off, rides the bounce now and steers to point
short and on middle, fended off the chest to the leg side
short on middle, the pressure is relentless, defended to mid-on
full on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
full and on middle, offcutter, dabbed to short midwicket
full and angled down leg for a wide
back of a length on middle, punched to the leg side
short on off, punched back to the bowler
shorter and outside off, punched to point
dug in on middle, swatted away like a fly to midwicket's right off the back foot
short on off, hops and fends it back to Loki
short and outside off, chopped to point
bouncer outside off, flies through to the keeper, beating the upper-cut, one for the over
short and outside off, miscued to the covers
short on the hips, clipped away neatly to deep square leg
full on off, swings in a touch, pushed up to mid-on off the front foot
worked off the pads to short midwicket, where the fielder fumbles
short and angling into the body, fended off to the leg side by Shadab
length and outside off, patted to point
homing in on the pads, deflected away for a leg bye

Horrid call from umpire Wilson and Hafeez had already burnt Pakistan's review. Top ball, though, Tossed up deliciously, drifts in at off, and breaks away sharply outside off. Shadab does not read it and plays inside and there's a daylight between bat and ball. There was a noise - came from bat jamming the ground. Poor, poor call from Wilson. Proper howler. Coach Arthur isn't impressed
short googly, spins away outside off, jabbed to the covers
pushed through to the covers
leans back and forces from outside off to the covers
worked with the break to short midwicket
full on the pads, Imad hangs back and flicks through the leg side
back of a length and angling away outside off, jumps back and flays it to point
full and slanting away outside off, Imad drives away from the body and collects fresh air
pitched up on middle, patted back down the pitch
back of a length and outside off, played to point
on a length and outside off, driven loosely to mid-on
glanced off the hips to fine leg
full on off, pushed down the ground to long-on
tossed outside off, driven off the front foot to the covers
googly, breaks back in, but the length is short, allowing the batsman to chop it away to extra-cover off the back foot
short and spins away outside off, punched to the covers
another wrong'un, an inside edge saves the batsman
short and wide outside off, backs away and slaps it up and over cover
back of a length on middle, pushed back to the bowler
full on the stumps, defended
back of a length on middle, defended back
slower cutter on middle, defended back
looks like a slider, short, knocked to the leg side off the back foot
tossed up down the leg side, beats the batsman and the keeper
full and straight, Sarfraz goes low and sweeps it deftly to long leg
whipped from outside off to short midwicket
looped up on middle, driven down to long-on off the front foot
sharp googly, spins back in a long way from outside off, Sarfraz reads it off the pitch and chops a single past the keeper fine on the off side
knocked into the vacant spaces at square leg off the back foot
shortish on middle, pulled to deep midwicket
shortish, middle stump line, tucked with the late inward movement to deep fine leg
full, angling into leg, clipped behind square leg
back of a length, given some width, opens up for a punch to the right of sweeper cover
short, climbs across his off-stump, left alone
full, pushed across, driven to sweeper cover
length, spinning away, opens up and taps to short third man
flights it up on leg, Sarfraz sweeps away to deep fine leg
full and flighted on middle, pushed to long-on
flighted into middle, eased away to long-on
full, spinning in, turned away to short fine
sweeps from around off behind square leg
short of a length on off, defended back
short, slanted across, tapped to third man
short of a length on middle, tucked to midwicket
full, dips as it curves into him, clipped to deep backward square
short of length on off, taps towards backward point who has a shy and concedes an overthrow
pushes across a length ball and Sarfraz gets an outside edge through first slip and gully
flighted on middle and off, clipped to midwicket
full on middle, turned away behind square
flighted on leg, drilled back
turns it away with the spin to square leg
short, makes some room and cuts to the left of point
googly, spins into him from a back of a length, Sarfraz backs away and manages to cut it away
good length outside off, punched to mid-off
short of a length, nips away outside off, opens the face to backward point
back of a length, angling in, tucked through midwicket
shortish, backs away and swats it away to mid-off
short, wide, cut to point
tucked around the corner for one
sweeps from middle behind square
advances down the ground and clips it back to the bowler
gets down and paddles a wrong'un over the keeper to fine leg
full on middle, pushed back
spins in from a length, backs away and blocks to cover
goes on with the arm outside off, cuts and finds point
back of a length, angled into the stumps, slapped down the track
back of a length, angled in, tries to whip it away and wears it on the pad
full on middle, drilled away towards mid-off
short of a length, angled into off, opens the face to third man
tucked behind square
full outside off, tries to squeeze it away but the ball sneaks through
wrong'un, spins in from a back of a length, tucked to midwicket
drives at a fuller ball after being invited with flight but it's the googly and gets an inside edge to midwicket. Lands in front
three in a row, this one's tapped away behind square on the off side

advances, gets to the pitch and smashes it straight over. Seems like it has crashed into the camera. Imad breaks the shackles. Just four fielders inside the circle. Imad was quick to point it out to the umpire
gets it over long-off. Only just but that's fine. Another skip down the track and chipped over off the bottom of the bat. Maximises the free hit
clips a fuller one through square leg
short of length, spins away, punched down to long-on
short of length, angled in, pins the pad and belts out an appeal. Not given. Might be too high and may miss leg with that angle. Angle's fine, actually, but height's dicey. No review taken
short ball, pulled to deep fine leg
short of length, opens the face to third man
back of a length, tucked to midwicket
fuller ball, driven to cover
full toss, driven to cover
sweeps early and the ball hits him on the elbow
spins away from a length, tapped to backward point
top-edges a sweep from leg stump line, lands short of deep backward square
sweeps a fuller one off the top edge, again to deep backward square
googly that turns away from a shortish length, slapped to sweeper cover
short, not much room, but he had made room and he laces a cut through backward point
short outside off, arches back and taps through backward point
short around off, drops it to third man with an open face
backs away and cops a fuller one on the pad as he tries to flick it away, rolls away to the off side
short of a length, backs away and slaps to extra cover
full toss, dips on him, swings and misses
full, middle and leg, swept through square leg
loses shape as he drags a pull to long-on
advances and clips to square leg who dives to his right but the ball drops short
spins into him and he tries to cut but chops it into the surface
short, spinning in, tries to pull but the ball goes off the thigh guard to fine leg. Given as runs, though, was there an inside edge?
tries to pull but doesn't get hold of it and chops it to the right of the keeper
sprayed down leg
short of length, tucked to deep midwicket
back of length, angled down leg again
full, clipped behind square
digs a yorker out
short, wide, cut to point
short of a length, throws hard hands at it and gets an outside edge to third man
short of a good length and outside off, Imad sits back and cracks it to point
slower cutter, on the pads, knocked to midwicket off the back foot
back of a length and slanting in at off, Sarfraz camps back and works it away into the vacant spaces at midwicket
shortish and outside off, nurdled away into the leg side for one more
short and outside off, sits up to be smacked. Sarfraz loads up and biffs a pull over midwicket

What a riposte from de Grandhomme! Off-stump yorker from de Grandhomme, Sarfraz jabs his bat down and deflects it back onto the stumps. He slams his bat on the turf and drags himself off the field. Is that the game?
short and outside off, down the track and flat-batted away to sweeper cover
back of a length and rips away outside off, squares up Ali and beats the outside edge
full on middle, Ali covers up in defence
short on off, defended back to the bowler
full around off, jabbed to the covers for one
inswinging yorker, inside-edged to midwidket

full and shaping into Ali, he falls over the flick and wears it on the pad. But, is it heading down the leg side. Not given by Wilson. Williamson challenges the on-field not-out decision. Ball-tracking suggests umpire's call on leg stump
mighty full and angling into the pads, they cross over for a leg bye
full-toss on off, sliced to long-off
pitched up and outside off, driven down to long-off
off-stump yorker, heaved to midwicket off the inside half
flaps a middle-stump full-toss to deep midwicket
on a length on middle, Imad steps away and carves it to mid-off
off-side wide
forced to midwicket off the inside half
knocks a slower offcutter to cover for one
tucked around the corner for one
full-toss outside off, sliced away to deep third man, where Munro slides but the ball sneaks away to the fence
picked up off the pads and flicked to deep square leg
just short of a good length and outside off, Ali has a crack at it and does not make contact
very full on off, 141ks, defended back off the back foot
full and wide outside off, Ali skies it. It kisses the stars and drops down in front of long-on
Imad shuffles across off, the bowler follows him, he misses the scoop
bouncer, flies over the head, wide
off the pad and rolls to the leg side
full-toss speared outside off, Hasan Ali swings down the wrong line
full on middle, hoicked to deep midwicket off the inside half
fullish on middle, backs away and slices it over the off-side infield
wide yorker, opens the face and guides to the left of sweeper cover
Ali backs away leg side, Boult slips in an offcutter and beats him emphatically
backs away and slices it just in front of KW at cover
yorker, reverse-swings in at leg stump, dug out through midwicket
yorker outside off, jammed to long-off
full on middle, uses his feet and drives past the bowler for two
full-toss on middle, spliced in front of long-on, and Imad gets to his fifty. Pakistan need him to find a higher gear
low full-toss on off, squeezed to mid-off

De Grandhomme throws himself to his right from backward point and catches this with both hands. Top work from him. Full-toss on middle, ramped away. It seemed to travel towards the boundary... until de Grandhomme swooped in. This chase is all but over for Pakistan
really full on off, forward and pressed to cover
slower legcutter outside off, Ali goes after it. He gets more height as opposed to distance. Holes out to Boult at the edge of the boundary. Taken at long-on
Ferguson wraps it up with a pinpoint middle-stump yorker. Afridi swings and misses. Ferguson hits his target and the celebrations begin in the NZ camp
